title: Oct 2016, It sounds fishy, something is going on
contents:
1) Open/Close/Drag
2) Connection lines
3) Note Boxes
4) Searching
5) Highlighting
6) Green Shrink Light Bulb

title: Sept 2016, What's going on? let us know! Think Aloud!
contents:
Please try to think out loud during your analysis—provide short verbal explanations of what you are doing and why. Additionally, I may periodically ask you to give a brief verbal explanation of a current goal or hypothesis that you are considering. Here are some examples of verbal updates that you might give:
I'm searching for Waldo because I am curious whether he was at the beach.
or
I thought that something interesting was happening with Mike in France, but I didn't find much. So now I'm looking for things related to apples.
or
I thought it was strange that Mike and Waldo both like apples, so now I'm trying to find out if they both like oranges.

title: Oct 2016, Time out! Can you explain me what's going on?
contents: At the end of the time, I will ask you to explain your hypotheses and explanation.

title: Sept 2016, Be smart! Figure out what's going on!
contents:
- Use whatever features you want to help you with the investigation.
The investigation period will be up to 90 minutes. Please do the best you can to address the prompt.

title: Sept 2016, Too many Notes to read! Use the Search!
contents: This synthetic data set is designed to be like a mix of data source coming from different sources, such as phone intercepts, emails, news articles and blog posts related to known or suspected criminals or terrorists.

title: Nov 2016, I said be smart! Connect related notes!
contents: Consider connections among people, organizations, and places.

title: Oct 2016, Write a note for each group of dialogs!
contents: It is recommended that you don’t start by trying to read a large number of the documents. Instead, use the “search” functionality to look for certain keywords that might be related to important information in the prompt.

title: Nov 2016, I bet you can't finnish reading all these dialoges in 90 minutes! don't go random!
contents: Do more searches to find connections between people, places, objects, or events that look promising or suspicious.

title: Nov 2016, Group similar dialoges in one side!
